public static int[] checkPositive(int[] ref,
                              String argName)
        Tests if all values in an array are positive: greater than zero.
        Parameters:
        ref - array of values to test. May be empty
        argName - argument name for ref, e.g., "valueList"
        Returns:
        the validated array
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if ref is null
        IllegalArgumentException - if any value is not positive

      • checkValueInsideRange

        @FullyTested
public static int[] checkValueInsideRange(int[] ref,
                                      int minRangeValue,
                                      int maxRangeValue,
                                      String argName)
        Tests if all values in an array are within specified range.

        Example: All values must be >= 3 and <= 7:
        checkValueInsideRange(numbersArray, 3, 7, "numbersArray");

        Parameters:
        ref - array of values to test. May be empty
        minRangeValue - minimum value (inclusive) for inclusive range of each value in array to test
        maxRangeValue - maximum value (inclusive) for inclusive range of each value in array to test
        argName - argument name for ref, e.g., "valueList"
        Returns:
        the validated array
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if ref is null
        IllegalArgumentException -
        • if minValue > maxValue
        • if any value of ref is outside allowed range
        See Also:
        checkValueInsideRange(Integer[], int, int, String), IntIterableArgs.checkValueInsideRange(Iterable, int, int, String)

      • checkValueInsideRange

      • checkValueOutsideRange

        @FullyTested
public static int[] checkValueOutsideRange(int[] ref,
                                       int minRangeValue,
                                       int maxRangeValue,
                                       String argName)
        Tests if all values in an array are not within specified range.

        Example: All values must be <= 3 and >= 7:
        checkValueInsideRange(numbersArray, 4, 6, "numbersArray");

        Parameters:
        ref - array of values to test. May be empty
        minRangeValue - minimum value (inclusive) for exclusive range of each value in array to test
        maxRangeValue - maximum value (inclusive) for exclusive range of each value in array to test
        argName - argument name for ref, e.g., "valueList"
        Returns:
        the validated array
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if ref is null
        IllegalArgumentException -
        • if minValue > maxValue
        • if any value of ref is inside not-allowed range
        See Also:
        checkValueOutsideRange(Integer[], int, int, String), IntIterableArgs.checkValueOutsideRange(Iterable, int, int, String)
